ca.coffeeshopstudio.icegl.controls

Interface IControl

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, CheckedButton, Control, Image, Label, Textbox

    public interface IControl

        Set the Exact Bottom position of the Control

      • setScale

        void setScale(float scale)
        Adjust the scale of the control

      • setTextureID

        void setTextureID(int textureID)
        Assign our control the specified texture
        Parameters:
        textureID - index of the texture to use

      • setTexturePosition

        void setTexturePosition(float x,
                      float y)
        Determine what part of the texture to start drawing from
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal position inside the texture to start drawing from
        y - vertical position inside the texture to start drawing from

      • setTextureOffset

        void setTextureOffset(float u,
                    float v)
        Set the offset (size) of the texture we "cut out" to draw with.
        Parameters:
        u - Horizontal offset
        v - Vertical offset

      • onSurfaceChanged

        void onSurfaceChanged()
        When we change the size of our surface, readjust the size of the control based on the grid

      • onDraw

        void onDraw(float[] mtrxProjView)
        Draw the control to our active surface
        Parameters:
        mtrxProjView - Our generated Projection/View matrix

      • move

        void move(float newLeft,
        float newBottom)
        Reposition our control based on the new grid coordinates
        Parameters:
        newLeft - new left most position based on our grid
        newBottom - new bottom most position based on our grid

      • moveRaw

        void moveRaw(float newLeft,
           float newBottom)
        Reposition our control using precise coordinates
        Parameters:
        newLeft - new left most position
        newBottom - new bottom most position

      • onTouch

        boolean onTouch(MotionEvent event)
        Basic onTouch handling to ensure we don't handle touch events for disabled / invisible controls
        Parameters:
        event - the touch event that occurred
        Returns:
        false if disabled, or the value returned from our callback listener

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set the enabled status of our control
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the control, false to disable

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(boolean visible)
        Set whether or not to display the control
        Parameters:
        visible - true to display the control, false to hie

      • onSurfaceCreated

        void onSurfaceCreated()
        Called when the GL Surface is first created

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns whether or not the control is enabled or disabled
        Returns:
        enabled status

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether or not we have hidden the control
        Returns:
        whether or not the control is shown

      • setDirty

        void setDirty(boolean dirty)
        If the control has been changed, set this to true to force it to redraw
        Parameters:
        dirty - if true, the control will be rebuilt
